column4: How Boehner can save his speakership  JPMorgan's lawyers  and the TV economics of the World Series

The assumption is that Boehner fears that the most zealous Republicans in his caucus would turn on him and remove him as speaker. With that in mind  there's one story I've been waiting for and still haven't seen: Why haven't the Democrats offer

column4: Taiwan stocks rise; heavyweights up
column5: TAIPEI  Oct 15 Taiwan stocks rose 0.8 percent on Tuesday  paced by gains in heavyweights such as TSMC  on expectations of an imminent deal to reopen the U.S. government and avoid a possible debt default.        At around one hour into trade  the main TAIEX index  had climbed to 8 337.65  joining other regional bourses in gains and recovering from a loss in the previous session.      TSMC  the world's top contact chip maker and the most heavily weighted stock  jumped 1 percent  boosti

column4: Telefonica set to sell $3.6 billion Czech stake: sources
column5: MADRID/LONDON Spanish telecoms group Telefonica has started preparing the sale of its $3.6 billion stake in its listed Czech unit  three sector bankers closely following the process but not directly involved said on Monday.

column4: Spain's mobile market shows signs of further recovery in August
column5: MADRID The number of mobile phone connections in Spain increased for a fourth straight month in August  data published on Tuesday showed  marking a tentative recovery after two years of client losses.

column4: Spanish stocks - Factors to watch on Tuesday
column5: The following Spanish stocks may be affected by newspaper reports and other factors on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified the newspaper reports  and cannot vouch for their accuracy:

column4: Telus sues AMC over threatened shutdown in contract dispute
column5: TORONTO Canadian telecom company Telus Corp is suing AMC to stop the maker of hit television shows "Mad Men" and "Breaking Bad" from withholding its content by the end of the month as it pushes for higher fees  a legal filing showed.

column4: Schwab posts highest profit since 2008  shares jump
column5: Charles Schwab Corp   a U.S. discount broker  posted its highest quarterly profit since the financial crisis on Tuesday as the rising U.S. stock market fueled more customer trading.

column4: Toyota considers Brazil for hybrid factory
column5: BRASILIA Toyota Motor Corp  presented the Brazilian government on Tuesday with a preliminary plan to establish a local factory building hybrid vehicles in exchange for new tax incentives.

column4: Toyota considers Brazil for hybrid factory
column5: BRASILIA  Oct 15 Toyota Motor Corp  presented the Brazilian government on Tuesday with a preliminary plan to establish a local factory building hybrid vehicles in exchange for new tax incentives.

column4: Toyota to cut up to 100 jobs in Australia as export orders drop
column5: SYDNEY Toyota Motor Corp  said on Tuesday it would cut up to 100 jobs in Australia  a move to downsize its production as export orders dropped.

column4: Toyota to cut up to 100 jobs in Australia as export orders drop
column5: SYDNEY  Oct 15 Toyota Motor Corp said on Tuesday it would cut up to 100 jobs in Australia  a move to downsize its production as export orders dropped.

column4: TransCanada to build Cushing storage by year-end
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 15 TransCanada Corp will complete construction of tank and storage facilities at the key Cushing  Oklahoma  oil storage hub late this year as part of its project for the southern leg of the Keystone XL pipeline  the company said on Tuesday.

column4: Wal-Mart predicts sales will grow faster next year
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  expects slightly stronger sales growth next year as it makes changes such as opening more smaller U.S. stores and shutting 50 poorly performing stores in Brazil and China  executives said on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 4-Wal-Mart predicts sales will grow faster next year
column5: * Walmart U.S. to use supercenters to ship to small stores

column4: Wal-Mart says U.S. government shutdown on customers' minds
column5: Oct 15 Wal-Mart Stores Inc sees the economy as "tough" and "unpredictable" around the world  and in the United States the government shutdown is on the minds of its customers  Chief Executive Officer Mike Duke said on Tuesday.

column4: Wal-Mart  Xerox blame each other for Louisiana shopping gone wild
column5: NEW ORLEANS Wal-Mart Stores Inc and Xerox Corp blamed each other on Monday after Louisiana food stamp recipients stripped bare the shelves of some Walmart stores when a computer glitch left their debit cards with no limits.

column4: Wal-Mart  Xerox blame each other for Louisiana shopping gone wild

column4: Weight Watchers better than self-help for weight loss
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters Health) - Compared to going it alone  using the Weight Watchers diet program helps people shed extra pounds  says a new study.

column4: UPDATE 1-Ivanhoé Cambridge buys 51 pct of News Corp headquarters
column5: NEW YORK  Oct 15 Ivanhoé Cambridge  the real estate investment arm of Canadian pension fund Caisse de Dépôt et Placement du Québec  on Tuesday said it acquired a 51 percent stake in the Manhattan skyscraper that serves as News Corp's  headquarters for more than $850 million.
